messages.content: In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural
Find %[1]s provider API reference/documentation link

Public Mural API docs: https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started
Enterprise API docs: https://developers.mural.co/enterprise/docs/welcome
Where can I create account and app for %[1]s provider?

Sing up via this link: https://app.mural.co/signup
To create a new app go here and click the New app button: https://app.mural.co/me/apps. First, provide the app name and redirect URI. Then you will get the client ID and client secret.
Give me list of all %[1]s provider API scopes
There is the list of all scopes: rooms:read, users:read, workspaces:read, murals:read, identity:read, templates:read, rooms:write, murals:write, templates:write
What are the different types of authentications %[1]s provider supports?
Public mural API uses OAuth2 Authentication. You can read more about OAuath2 authentication here: https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/oauth
For %[1]s provider tell me in what time access and refresh tokens expires in %[1]s provider API?
Access token expires in 15 minutes. I didn't find information about refresh token expiration time.
What entities or objects could be queried via the %[1]s provider API? Provide links to the API documentation for each object or entity:

Here are some of the main API entities that can be queried via the Mural API:
1)Rooms - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/rooms
2)Users - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/users
3)Workspaces - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/workspaces
4)Murals - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/murals
5)Templates - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/templates
6)Mural Contents - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/mural-contents
Give information about %[1]s provider API rate limits

Mural has a User rate limit and a Client application rate limit.
User rate limit: 25 requests/user/second
Client application rate limit: 10,000/app/min
For %[1]s provider API give me information about what rate limit headers are returned in response:

Mural API returns rate limit headers in response. Here are the headers:
1)X-RateLimit-Limit - User rate limit
2)X-RateLimit-Remaining - How many requests are available for the user until the rate limit reset
3)X-RateLimit-Reset - Timestamp when the user rate limit will reset
4)X-RateLimit-App-Limit - Client application rate limit
5)X-RateLimit-App-Remaining - How many requests are available for the client application until the rate limit reset
6)X-RateLimit-App-Reset - Timestamp when the client application rate limit will reset
Does %[1]s provider API support batch or bulk operations? What API endpoints support batch or bulk operations in %[1]s provider API?

According to this changelog: https://developers.mural.co/public/changelog/mural-api-changelog-2022-11-15 create sticky note endpoint(https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/createstickynote), create text box endpoint(https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/createtextbox) and create title endpoint(https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/createtitle) supports bulk operations.
%[1]s provider in API supports link based or offset based pagination? Tell me about pagination limits

Mural uses token pagination. Each resource type has its own default page size of 100 or fewer. 
Mural uses two pagination query params limit and next. With the next key use the token to get access to the next page
What is the error response format in %[1]s provider API?
The version of the restful API is usually a part of the endpoint url, e.g. for version 4 the url looks like http://example.com/users/v4/1234/. How many versions of such api is available for %[1]s?:
The current version of Mural API is v1
Do the %[1]s developers publish API changelog information? If so tell me where i can find %[1]s changelog and give me a link with %[1]s changelog
You can find Mural API changelog here: https://developers.mural.co/public/changelog
In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Wrike
Find %[1]s provider API reference/documentation link
https://developers.wrike.com/overview/
Where can I create account and app for %[1]s provider?

Create an account at: https://www.wrike.com/vak/. After this confirm your email.
Create an app here: https://www.wrike.com/frontend/apps/index.html#/api.
Give me list of all %[1]s provider API scopes

In API Reference you can find required scopes for every endpoint. For example, https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/#query-contacts endpoint needs to have one of three scopes: Default, wsReadOnly, wsReadWrite.

There is the list of all scopes: Default, wsReadOnly, wsReadWrite, amReadOnlyUser, amReadWriteUser, amReadOnlyGroup, amReadWriteGroup, amReadOnlyInvitation, amReadWriteInvitation, amReadOnlyWorkflow, amReadWriteWorkflow, amReadOnlyTimelogCategory, amReadWriteTimelogCategory, dataExportFull, amReadOnlyAuditLog, amReadOnlyAccessRole, amReadOnlyWorkSchedule, amReadWriteWorkSchedule
What are the different types of authentications %[1]s provider supports?
Wrike supports OAuth2 and permanent token(API key) authentication types.
For %[1]s provider tell me in what time access and refresh tokens expires in %[1]s provider API?
Access token expires after 1 hour. I didn't find information about refresh token expiration time.
What entities or objects could be queried via the %[1]s provider API? Provide links to the API documentation for each object or entity:

Here are some of the main API entities that can be queried via the Attio API:
1)Contacts - https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/
2)Users - https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/users/
3)Groups - https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/
4)Tasks - https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/
5)Workflows - https://developers.wrike.com/api/workflows
6)Invitations - https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/invitations/
Give information about %[1]s provider API rate limits
I didn't find information about rate limits in Wrike API documentation.
For %[1]s provider API give me information about what rate limit headers are returned in response:
I didn't find information about rate limit headers in Wrike API documentation.
Does %[1]s provider API support batch or bulk operations? What API endpoints support batch or bulk operations in %[1]s provider API?

Batch export endpoint:
https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/data-export/

Groups have update in bulk endpoint.
https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/
%[1]s provider in API supports link based or offset based pagination? Tell me about pagination limits
Wrike API supports offset-based pagination. The maximum number of items per page is 1000.
What is the error response format in %[1]s provider API?
The version of the restful API is usually a part of the endpoint url, e.g. for version 4 the url looks like http://example.com/users/v4/1234/. How many versions of such api is available for %[1]s?:
The current version of Wrike API is v4
Do the %[1]s developers publish API changelog information? If so tell me where i can find %[1]s changelog and give me a link with %[1]s changelog
You can find Wrike API changelog here: https://developers.wrike.com/change-log/
